thread.title: Storm Doris: Thousands of NI homes lose power
thread.title_full: Storm Doris: Thousands of NI homes lose power

title: Storm Doris: Thousands of NI homes lose power
text:
Close share panel Media caption The latest forecast for Northern Ireland About 8,000 homes and businesses are without power in Northern Ireland as Storm Doris lashes the UK. 
Southern areas of NI have been worst hit and NI Networks says the figure is likely to rise. 
It said trees and branches falling onto overhead electricity lines is the main cause of the damage. 
A yellow warning of rain for all counties is in place until 14:00 GMT and a yellow warning for wind until 20:00 GMT in counties Antrim and Down. 
A number of roads have been blocked by fallen trees and power outages have been reported. 
At the George Best City Airport KLM flights to and from Amsterdam have been cancelled on Thursday afternoon. Roads affected by fallen trees Sydenham bypass outside Victoria Park heading out of Belfast towards City Airport Road at Tullylish, between Banbridge and Gilford Carrickmore to Pomeroy road Roslyn Sligo Road outside Enniskillen Derrylin Road north of Bellanaleck Dungannon Road heading out of Aughnacloy Ballykeel Road, south Down
